subject: Re: [junit] Setting up an in-memory database?
msgSnippet: Michael, It may look like an overkill but you can use Hibernate s automatic schema generation capability to create the schema at startup. You don t have to use
messageBody:
Michael,

It may look like an overkill but you can use Hibernate's automatic
schema generation capability to create the schema at startup. You
don't have to use Hibernate for anything else. It will read the schema
information from the XML files. If you're already familiar with
Hibernate, it's not at all hard to do it.

Hope this helps,

- Yagiz Erkan -
http://yagiz.blogspot.com
http://www.erkans.com
